newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: S.Korean stocks seen falling on troubles rumours.
newsitem.headline: S.Korean stocks seen falling on troubles rumours.

text.p: South Korean stocks are forecast to decline further on Friday as rumours of more corporate financial troubles would continue to depress sentiment, brokers said.
But Ssangyong Group SSYG.CN firms were seen rising on Thursday's remarks by group officials about a possible deal with General Motors Corp on capital investment in its auto unit.
Thursday's release of gross domestic product figures for the first quarter would have little impact, brokers said.
The composite index closed Thursday's trading at 724.38, down 13.33 points or 1.81 percent.
"Rumours of corporate troubles are spreading so widely that investors just want to flee and stay away until the market becomes quiet," said Koh Kyung-bae of Hyundai Securities.
The Haitai Group was hit hard by such rumours and strongly denied by the group, but shares in its listed affiliates plunged for the past two days.
A Ssangyong Group executive said on Thursday it was discussing with foreign companies on a $300 million capital investment in its loss-making Ssangyong Motor.
The nation's gross domestic product grew 5.4 percent in the first quarter, down from a 7.8 percent rise a year earlier.
